availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Radford J. Maxey (Monroe County, Kentucky, surveyor)

body.p: Monroe County, Kentucky, surveyor. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Evans Maxey. Father of John Maxey, William Maxey, Susanna G. Maxey, James Maxey, Eliza Maxey, Thomas Maxey, Radford J. Maxey, and Lucy D. Maxey. Surveyor in Monroe County in 1850. Surveyor in Monroe County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Monroe County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Monroe County, p. 372B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Monroe County, Tompkinsville, p. 188-89.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Monroe County, Tompkinsville, p. 211A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Monroe County, Tompkinsville, p. 72A.
Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates – Microfilm (1911-1964), KDLA, Roll #7016189, Monroe County Deaths, File #16062.
Find A Grave, "Radford Josiah Maxey (1823-1866),”Memorial #14275470, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/14275470 (accessed April 20, 2018).
